definition: clothes/dress/garment/to serve (in the military, a prison sentence etc)/to obey/to be convinced (by an argument)/to convince/to admire/to acclimatize/to take (medicine)/mourning clothes/to wear mourning clothes
affair/business/matter/to be engaged in/to attend to/by all means
to be born/to give birth/life/to grow/raw/uncooked/student

sentences.english: They usually leave some money for the waiter.
sentences.chinese: 他们通常会付给服务生一些钱。

sentences.english: I would say a lot of people work as waitresses or waiters.
Please follow the attendant into the massage parlor .
sentences.chinese: 当然，请跟服务生去按摩室吧。

sentences.english: The waiter turns on his heel and marches our order back to the kitchen.
sentences.chinese: 服务生原地向后转，快步走向厨房。

sentences.english: The waiter goes to clean up the glass.
sentences.chinese: 于是服务生去清理破掉的杯子。

sentences.english: Did you give the gratuity to the waiter in the restaurant?
sentences.chinese: 你有给餐厅服务生小费吗？

sentences.english: Do you ask your friends or the waiter?
sentences.chinese: 问自己的朋友还是问服务生？

sentences.english: Please give this to our Lane Servant.
sentences.chinese: 请把这个给我们得球道服务生。

sentences.english: The girls earn spending money by waiting at table in the school dining-room.
sentences.chinese: 这个女孩在学校餐厅当服务生以赚取零用钱。

sentences.english: When they needed a refill, they used the whistle to get some service.
sentences.chinese: 当他们要新来一杯时，就用吹吹口哨叫服务生。

sentences.english: At six o'clock the waiter brought her dinner and carried away the typewritten bill of fare.
sentences.chinese: 六点钟，服务生送来她的晚餐，并取走了打好的菜单。

sentences.english: Welty's new friends immediately sent a waiter to find a cab.
sentences.chinese: 韦尔蒂的新朋友们立刻让服务生去叫个出租车。

sentences.english: A waitress serves butter beer at the Hogshead Pub.
sentences.chinese: 猪头酒吧前，服务生在售卖黄油啤酒。

sentences.english: There are many waitresses that aspire to be actresses.
sentences.chinese: 有许多的女服务生向往成为女演员。

sentences.english: I'm bellman…What can I do for you ?
sentences.chinese: 我是服务生。我能为您做什么呀？

sentences.english: We left the tip for the waiter，because he was really friendly.
sentences.chinese: 我们留给服务生小费，因为他的态度很友善。

definition: abbr. for 侍應生|侍应生[shi4 ying4 sheng1]
compartment (of train, ship etc)/private room at restaurant/rented room for karaoke/hotel room rented by the hour
